Package com.luigisgro.cqf.montecarlo

The Monte Carlo framework, in a generic implementation for curve time series, with a generic number of factors.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
MonteCarloEvaluator<T extends TimePoint> Objects responsible for calculating the derivative value corresponding to a given iteration of the Monte Carlo simulation, from a state of the underlying (scenario).
MultiFactorModel This interface isolates the model-depending features of a Monte Carlo simulation: the generation of a scenario for the underlying.
RandomVectorGenerator Generator of vectors with a suitable distribution for Monte Carlo integration
 

Class Summary
CurveTimeSeriesOperatorEvaluator<T extends TimePoint> A simple evaluator that always stop at the given number of iterations
JDKUncorrelatedStandardVectorGenerator Basic implementation of RandomVectorGenerator that uses the native random generator of the Java Virtual Machine
MersenneTwisterStandardVectorGenerator Quasi random generator using the Commons Math library to generate Mersenne Twister sequences
MonteCarloSimulation<T extends TimePoint> Skeleton of a Monte Carlo simulation.
StandardErrorEvaluator<T extends TimePoint> An implementation of MonteCarloEvaluator based on the notion of "standard error".
 

Package com.luigisgro.cqf.montecarlo Description

The Monte Carlo framework, in a generic implementation for curve time series, with a generic number of factors.

The class MonteCarloSimulation handles:

  • the generation of the random vectors, by means of a RandomVectorGenerator
  • the iterative generation of scenarios, by means a MultiFactorModel, which is responsible of the simulation of the underlyings
  • the feeding of the scenarios to a MonteCarloEvaluator, which knows how to generate a value for the portfolio and when to stop the simulation
Apart from the classes implementing RandomVectorGenerator, this package contains no specific logic, as it is meant as a generic framework for iterative simulations.
